results.title: New Foreign Minister Puts Peace on Korean Peninsula First
results.summary: South Korea's new Foreign Minister Cho Hyun prioritizes peace on the Korean Peninsula through inter-Korean dialogue with the U.S., criticizing the previous administration's diplomacy as driven by "domestic political purposes." Cho aims for a "win-win solution" with the U.S. on tariff negotiations. "South Korea must ease tensions on the Korean Peninsula and create a path for dialogue with North Korea in close coordination with the US to that end." This pursuit of peace should be rooted in faith and discernment, not political expediency (Matthew 6:33).

results.title: Regionalisation of Mining Supply Chains: Global Shifts and Strategic Control
results.summary: This article discusses the global shift towards regionalized mining supply chains due to national security concerns and the desire of resource-rich nations to increase their economic benefits. It highlights China's dominance in mineral processing and the strategic weaponization of supply chains. The article also points out the challenges of market volatility, trade policies, and the need for transparency in government deals. It mentions the Middle East and Africa as emerging leaders in this transformation. Key quote: "China really has locked up the processing capabilities for battery metals, rare earths used in defense." The content lacks explicit faith-based alignment and focuses on economic and geopolitical strategies.

results.title: Forum: Choose Wisely - Adapting Legal Strategies in Asia
results.summary: In-house counsel in Asia are reassessing their expectations of external law firms due to geopolitical upheaval and technological advancements. They seek strategic collaboration, proactive risk anticipation, and forward-thinking solutions. Adam Au of Toys"R"Us Asia emphasizes the need for firms to flag potential geopolitical issues and embrace AI. Daniel Lim of HL Bank Singapore requires law firms to provide immediately actionable legal intelligence amidst regulatory noise. Maria Elms of Vitasoy International Holdings values cross-border capabilities and insights into regional regulatory landscapes, particularly in Asia-Pacific. Michael Folsom of HSBC highlights the importance of trust and human relationships despite technological changes. Scripture reminds us in Proverbs 3:5-6 to "Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths," emphasizing that true wisdom comes from God, not just worldly expertise.
